title: Leonard French's stained glass screens [Italian version]
creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Michael Thornhill
brief_description: The National Library in Canberra is the repository of some of the most distinguished works of art in Australia. Among them is a set of twelve stained glass screens executed by painter Leonard French. Taking as his theme the planets, French designed a set of screens which drew on the craggy beauty of medieval stained glass for their inspiration. In Italian language.
